meanings.definition: The belief or doctrine that there is no reality outside of human perception or that reality is unknowable.
meanings.sent1: In antirealism, it is thought that reality is only what we can see and feel.
meanings.sent2: Her antirealism led her to question the existence of anything beyond her own senses.
meanings.sent3: The antirealism of the situation made him doubt the truth of everything around him.
meanings.sent4: His mind was clouded by antirealism, unable to accept anything beyond his immediate experience.
meanings.sent5: The concept of antirealism painted a world where truth was a mere illusion.

meanings.definition: A philosophical position that denies the existence of an objective reality independent of human perception.
meanings.sent1: Antirealism challenges the idea of a reality existing independently of our minds.
meanings.sent2: The debate on antirealism often revolves around the nature of truth and perception.
meanings.sent3: She humorously remarked that her cat's antirealism made it believe it was the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting captured the essence of antirealism, blurring the lines between reality and imagination.
meanings.sent5: The professor's lecture on antirealism left the students questioning the very fabric of their existence.
